title: BBEdit Expert Preferences - Clippings, Editing and Text Completion (com.barebones.bbedit)
description: There are a number of behaviors in BBEdit for which there are no UI controls in the Preferences window; this is typically because the settings are so obscure that placing them in the Preferences window would just make it complicated. In fact, some of these settings were in the Preferences window, and have been removed in order to simplify the interface; in such cases, any changes you made previously will be honored, even though the UI in the Preferences window is gone. https://www.barebones.com/support/bbedit/ExpertPreferences.html

AllowShiftRightToIndentWhitespaceOnlyLin.title: Allow Shift Right To Indent Whitespace Only Lines
AllowShiftRightToIndentWhitespaceOnlyLin.description: By default, the 'Shift Right' command on the Text menu will not add indentation to lines that are empty or consist entirely of white space. Set to ‘true’ f you would prefer to indent every line, regardless of its whitespace-only nature.

AllowShiftRightToIndentWhitespaceOnlyLin.title: Allow Shift Right To Indent Whitespace Only Lines C++
AllowShiftRightToIndentWhitespaceOnlyLin.description: Only for C++ language. By default, the 'Shift Right' command on the Text menu will not add indentation to lines that are empty or consist entirely of white space. Set to ‘true’ f you would prefer to indent every line, regardless of its whitespace-only nature.

BalanceIncludesDelimiters.title: Balance Includes Delimiters
BalanceIncludesDelimiters.description: By default, the 'Balance' command (or double-clicking on a delimiter to balance) does not include the delimiters in the resulting selection.

BRIEFStateTimeout.title: BRIEF State Timeout
BRIEFStateTimeout.description: The progressive (BRIEF compatible) behavior of the Home and End keys operates within a specific time period; if you wait longer than that, the behavior state resets. The factory default timeout period is ten seconds. Value is some floating point value (x.y) greater than zero (e.g 1.0 or 2.5).

CommentWholeLineWithInsertionPoint.title: Comment Whole Line With Insertion Point
CommentWholeLineWithInsertionPoint.description: When using the Un/Comment command, if nothing is selected, BBEdit will use the line comment delimiter to comment (or uncomment) the entire line. Set to ‘true’ f you would prefer that BBEdit insert the line-comment delimiter at the insertion point instead.

Editor_AutoWordCountSizeThreshold.title: Editor Auto Word Count Size Threshold
Editor_AutoWordCountSizeThreshold.description: Automatic word counting is disabled for documents over a set size threshold, in order to avoid needless delays when working on very large documents. The factory default is 16M (16777216) characters, but you may change this limit as desired. Setting it to zero disables the limit check entirely.

Editor_ControlArrowCamelCase.title: Editor Control Arrow Camel Case
Editor_ControlArrowCamelCase.description: BBEdit supports 'camel case' navigation: press Control-left-arrow or Control-right-arrow to jump to the next (or previous) transition from lower-case to upper-case characters (or a word boundary, whichever comes first). Note that this use of Control-left-arrow and Control-right-arrow replaces the pre-8.5 behavior of using these key combinations to scroll horizontally.

Editor_ControlArrowHScroll.title: Editor Control Arrow Horizontal Scroll
Editor_ControlArrowHScroll.description: BBEdit supports 'camel case' navigation: press Control-left-arrow or Control-right-arrow to jump to the next (or previous) transition from lower-case to upper-case characters (or a word boundary, whichever comes first). Note that this use of Control-left-arrow and Control-right-arrow replaces the pre-8.5 behavior of using these key combinations to scroll horizontally.

Editor_DeleteIndentationWhitespaceToTabS.title: Editor Delete Indentation Whitespace To Tab Stop
Editor_DeleteIndentationWhitespaceToTabS.description: When you backspace from the insertion point, BBEdit will delete a tab stop's worth of spaces if there are only spaces (and tabs) between the insertion point and the start of the line on which you're editing.

Editor_SpellCheckLengthLimit.title: Editor Spell Check Length Limit
Editor_SpellCheckLengthLimit.description: Since 'Find All Misspelled Words' is pretty much pointless on files over a certain size, the maximum amount of text checked by this command is limited to 1M (1048576) characters. Setting it to zero disables the limit check entirely.

FlashBalancePointsWhenNavigating.title: Flash Balance Points When Navigating
FlashBalancePointsWhenNavigating.description: When you use the right-arrow key to navigate over a closing delimiter (right paren/brace/bracket/curly quote), the opening delimiter will be briefly highlighted.

LegacyUndoSelectionBehavior.title: Legacy Undo Selection Behavior
LegacyUndoSelectionBehavior.description: When performing an Undo or Redo and the selection range changes, the Undo/Redo operation will select the affected text, rather than updating the Undo/Redo state to include the actual current selection range. If however you prefer the classic behavior (as implemented from the beginning of time up through BBEdit 11.6), set this to ‘true’.

MaxDocumentLengthForCompletionTokenizer.title: Max Document Length For Completion Tokenizer
MaxDocumentLengthForCompletionTokenizer.description: Text completions that depend on examining the document's contents (both for tokens in the document, and for possible completions from the system spelling checker) are now skipped when the document is above a certain size. Setting it to zero disables the limit check entirely.

PrecomposeUnicodeWhenPasting.title: Precompose Unicode When Pasting
PrecomposeUnicodeWhenPasting.description: If you find that you frequently need to bring in text which contains combining Unicode characters (as are frequently found in PDFs generated on other platforms, for example), it can be desirable to preprocess the combining characters into one composed character where possible. This is not a general need, but if you run into it often enough, set this to ‘true’. (Despite the name, the precomposition is done when BBEdit imports the Clipboard from other applications, not when the paste is actually done.) Note that this requires an additional copy of the Clipboard when the application imports the text, and for very large pastes, there may be a noticeable delay while the text gets precomposed. Thus, you should only turn on this setting when you are frequently working with text that contains combining Unicode characters.

UseClippingsForCompletion.title: Use Clippings For Completion
UseClippingsForCompletion.description: If there is a partial word to the immediate left of the insertion point, the 'Insert Clipping...' command will attempt to autocomplete that word based clipping names in the current and universal set (using a 'begins with' style match.)

UseTabKeyAsCompletionTrigger.title: Use Tab Key As Completion Trigger
UseTabKeyAsCompletionTrigger.description: If you like, you can use the Tab key to trigger text completion.
